title: 104_hr3248
content: The Act "Veterans Programs Amendments of 1996" includes provisions for presuming service connection for bronchiolo-alveolar carcinoma, granting permanent and total disability for veterans over 65 in nursing homes, and implementing a pilot program for disability examinations by contract physicians. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may conduct a pilot program allowing examinations for medical disability to be done by non-VA personnel through contracts. The program is limited to 10 regional offices and funded from existing VA resources. A report to Congress is required within three years of the program's enactment. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit a report to Congress on the impact of using non-VA personnel for medical disability examinations. SEC. 5 increases the automobile allowance from $5,500 to $6,000 under title 38, United States Code. The amendment applies to purchases made after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 6 specifies the effective date for discontinuing certain veterans' benefits upon the recipient's death. Section 5112(b)(1) of title 38, United States Code is amended regarding the payment of benefits in cases of marriage, remarriage, or death of the payee. The amendment specifies the last day of the month for benefit payments in these situations. Additionally, a new subsection is added for the discontinuance of payment of compensation. The amendments made by this section specify the payment details for the final month of compensation or pension in case of discontinuance. The effective date for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses is also clarified. These amendments apply to the death of recipients after October 1, 1998. SEC. 7 amends the period for which accrued benefits are payable from "one year" to "two years". SEC. 8 imposes a limitation on clothing allowance for incarcerated veterans. SEC. 8 imposes a limitation on clothing allowance for incarcerated veterans, reducing the annual allowance for veterans incarcerated for over 60 days and provided clothing by the institution. SEC. 9 addresses the repair and long-term maintenance of war memorials. Section 5(b)(2) of the Act of March 4, 1923 is amended to allow the Commission to enter into arrangements with sponsors of war memorials for repair and maintenance. Funds transferred for this purpose will be deposited into a fund for maintenance and repair expenses. The Commission shall deposit private contributions into a fund for maintenance and repair expenses. The Secretary of the Treasury shall credit interest and proceeds from obligations held in the fund. Any excess funds will be invested in interest-bearing obligations of the United States.
